data.title: Upcoming Events in Santa Fe
data.meta_description: Whether you're catching a concert with friends or watching a show with family, discover all the great performers and entertainment at Buffalo Thunder.
data.text:
Scotty mccreery

Join us September 13 for Scotty McCreery. ​Get ready for an unforgettable night with country sensation Scotty McCreery! Join us on Friday, September 13th, for an electrifying performance that will leave you wanting more.

With his fifth studio album, "Same Truck," set to release on September 17, 2021, Scotty McCreery is gearing up to bring his latest hits straight to you. Don't miss the chance to hear his chart-topping single, "You Time," live and experience the magic of his new music firsthand.

Hailing from North Carolina, McCreery has soared to success with three consecutive No. 1 hits from his previous album, "Seasons Change," earning him widespread acclaim and a dedicated fanbase. His talent as a songwriter shines through with ten tracks on "Same Truck" crafted by his own pen.

With all four of his albums debuting at No. 1 on the Billboard Albums chart and over 3 million copies sold, McCreery's accolades speak volumes. From winning "American Idol" to earning prestigious awards like the ACM New Artist of the Year, his impact on the country music scene is undeniable.

Don't miss your chance to witness Scotty McCreery live in concert!

food truck fiesta

​Get ready for a culinary adventure at Buffalo Thunder Resort and Casino's Food Truck Fiesta on Saturday, September 21! Join us for a day packed with delicious eats from the area's best food trucks, beer garden, music, and entertainment. Bring your friends and family to enjoy a feast of flavors, dancing, and fun. This is the season’s hottest event you don’t want to miss!

Date: Saturday, September 21

Time: 12n – 5pm

Advance Tickets: $15

At the Door: $20

lee greenwood with special guest Johnny lee

​Join us for an unforgettable evening with country music icon Lee Greenwood, featuring special guest Johnny Lee.

Lee Greenwood's expansive career boasts multiple CMA and ACM Awards, a Grammy for Top Male Vocal Performance on “I.O.U,” and numerous prestigious nominations. With twenty-two studio albums, seven compilation albums, seven No. 1 hits, and thirty-eight singles, Greenwood's discography includes classics like “It Turns Me Inside Out,” “Ring On Her Finger Time on Her Hands,” and “God Bless the U.S.A.” The latter has achieved the unique distinction of reaching the top five on the country singles charts three times and the Top 20 of the Billboard Hot 100 shortly after 9/11. Known for his patriotism and support of the U.S. military, Greenwood has been honored with the Congressional Medal of Honor Society’s National Patriot’s Award and has entertained troops on over 30 USO Tours.

Johnny Lee, born in Texas City, Texas, and raised on a dairy farm in Alta Loma, found fame with the hit "Lookin' for Love" from the "Urban Cowboy" soundtrack. After serving in the U.S. Navy, he played in Texas nightclubs and spent ten years touring with Mickey Gilley. Lee's chart-topping hits include “One in a Million,” “Bet Your Heart on Me,” and “The Yellow Rose.”

Stephen Pearcy of ratt and Quiet riot

​Don't miss our November 9th concert featuring Stephen Pearcy of RATT and Quiet Riot!

Stephen Pearcy, the visionary founder, lead singer, and songwriter of RATT, returns to the spotlight. With his electrifying presence and uniquely salacious vocals, Pearcy led RATT to mega multi-platinum success with hits like "Round and Round" and "Lay It Down." From their debut album "Out of the Cellar" to "Infestation," RATT has sold over 20 million records worldwide.

Joining the lineup is Quiet Riot, the iconic rock phenomenon, known for hits like "Metal Health" and "Cum On Feel the Noize." With over 15 million records sold, Quiet Riot continues to captivate audiences worldwide.

Featuring legendary bassist Rudy Sarzo and a lineup including Jizzy Pearl and Johnny Kelly, get ready for an unforgettable night of metal madness!

Get your tickets now and prepare to rock out like never before!

​THE MARSHALL TUCKER BAND & JEFFERSON STARSHIP

Two iconic bands are coming together for a historic road show, bringing their collective hits to American audiences across the nation. Today, legendary southern rock group The Marshall Tucker Band (MTB) and rock staple Jefferson Starship announced their joint Live on Cloud 9 Tour. The first leg of the tour, nine concerts (with more to come), have been announced with stops in California, Nevada, Oregon and Washington state.The two bands have a history dating back to the 1970s, and MTB lead singer Doug Gray couldn’t be more thrilled about reuniting with Jefferson Starship.

“We have a storied history with Jefferson Starship,” explains Gray. “We toured together many years ago and the timing feels right for us to reunite. We’re on Cloud 9!”

"We are really looking forward to touring with our buddies, The Marshall Tucker Band," says Donny Baldwin of Jefferson Starship. "We toured back in the day, and it will be a great night of music from two iconic bands. See you there!"

April wine and Molly Hatchet

Get ready for a night of rock ‘n’ roll history as April Wine and Molly Hatchet take the stage on Saturday, December 21st! These legendary bands, known for their incredible live performances and enduring hits, promise an unforgettable evening of music.

April Wine

Hailing from Halifax, Nova Scotia, April Wine is a Canadian rock band that has been captivating audiences since 1969. With over 20 albums released since 1971, the band achieved international fame in the 1970s and 1980s. Featuring timeless classics like ‘Roller’, ‘I Like to Rock’, and ‘You Could Have Been a Lady’, their iconic power ballad ‘Just Between You and Me’ earned them the distinction of being the first Canadian band to appear on MTV. April Wine's illustrious career includes 11 Juno Award nominations and inductions into both the Canadian Music Industry Hall of Fame and the Canadian Music Hall of Fame.

Molly Hatchet

Emerging from Jacksonville, Florida, in the early 1970s, Molly Hatchet epitomizes Southern Rock. Named after a legendary 17th-century axe murderess, the band burst onto the scene with their self-titled debut album in 1978, reaching multi-platinum status. They solidified their place in rock history with the release of ‘Flirtin’ with Disaster’ in 1979. Despite lineup changes over the years, the band has maintained their signature style with hits like ‘Gator Country’ and ‘Whiskey Man’. Molly Hatchet continues to tour extensively, bringing energetic live performances to fans worldwide, and their current lineup upholds the band’s legacy, keeping Southern Rock alive and kicking.
